What is Nepal Telecom's Privacy Policy?

Nepal Telecom's Privacy Policy informs customers about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information through our website, social media channels, and mobile app. These platforms allow customers to access product information, self-care services, package subscriptions, recharge services, balance transfers, and more. By using our services, you agree to our information collection and usage practices as described in this policy.

What personal information does Nepal Telecom collect?

Nepal Telecom may collect certain personally identifiable information to provide better services, including but not limited to: Location data, Contact information, Camera access (for specific features), SMS access (for verification), Storage access, and other information necessary for service delivery. We collect this information when you install our app, visit our website, register, fill out forms, or enter information on our platforms.

How does Nepal Telecom use my information?

Nepal Telecom uses your information for several purposes: 1) To personalize your experience and deliver content/products you're interested in, 2) To improve our app/website for better service, 3) To respond to your customer service requests, 4) To administer contests, promotions, surveys or other site features, 5) To send periodic emails about orders or other products/services, 6) To follow up after correspondence (live chat, email, or phone inquiries).

Does Nepal Telecom share my information with third parties?

Nepal Telecom may employ third-party companies and individuals for: facilitating our services, providing services on our behalf, performing service-related tasks, or analyzing service usage. These third parties have access to your personal information to perform their assigned tasks, but they are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose. We do not share your contact details (like email) from our e-newsletter with any other parties.

What is Log Data and how does Nepal Telecom use it?

Log Data is information collected when errors occur in our website/app, gathered through third-party products. This may include: your device's Internet Protocol (IP) address, device name, operating system version, app configuration when using our service, time and date of service use, and other statistics. This data helps us identify and fix technical issues.

Does Nepal Telecom use cookies?

Our service does not explicitly use cookies, but our website/app may use third-party code and libraries that use cookies to collect information and improve services. You can choose to accept or refuse these cookies. If you refuse cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our service. Cookies are small data files sent to your browser from visited websites and stored on your device's internal memory.

How secure is my personal information with Nepal Telecom?

Nepal Telecom values your trust and strives to protect your personal information using commercially acceptable means. However, no method of internet transmission or electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable. We cannot guarantee absolute security. We recommend being cautious when sharing personal information online and using secure connections when accessing our services.

What happens when I click on third-party links in Nepal Telecom's app/website?

Our service may contain links to third-party sites/apps. When you click these links, you'll be directed to those external sites. These sites are not operated by Nepal Telecom. We strongly advise reviewing their privacy policies as we have no control over their content, privacy policies, or practices. Nepal Telecom assumes no responsibility for third-party sites or services.

What is Nepal Telecom's policy for email newsletters?

Nepal Telecom does not share your contact details (email addresses) from our e-newsletter with any other parties. The information on our website/app is for general purposes only. We take reasonable measures to ensure accuracy and work to keep our platforms functioning smoothly. However, we disclaim liability for temporary unavailability due to technical issues beyond our control.

Can Nepal Telecom change its Privacy Policy?

Yes, Nepal Telecom may update our Privacy Policy periodically. We advise reviewing this page regularly for changes. We will notify you of changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on our website/app page. Changes become effective immediately after being posted. It's your responsibility to stay informed about updates to our privacy practices.

You can contact Nepal Telecom about privacy policy questions or suggestions at:

Nepal Telecom,
Office of Chief Commercial Officer,
Head Office, Bhadrakali, Kathmandu.
Email: ntc.cco@ntc.net.np

You can reach out with any questions or concerns about how we handle your personal information.

Do I have to agree to the Privacy Policy to use Nepal Telecom services?

Yes, by choosing to use Nepal Telecom's services through our website, app, or social media channels, you agree to the collection and use of information as described in our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with our practices, you should not use our services. The policy terms have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions unless otherwise defined.

Why does Nepal Telecom need access to my camera, SMS, and storage?

Nepal Telecom may require access to your camera, SMS, and storage for specific service features and functionality. For example: camera access might be needed for scanning documents or QR codes, SMS access for verification purposes, and storage access for saving documents or media related to our services. These permissions help us provide a better, more functional user experience tailored to service needs.
